intro: Rhinotropis nitida var. tamaulipana, commonly known as the Tamaulipan rhinoceros plant, is a flowering plant native to the Tamaulipan moist forests of northeastern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with slender, branching stems and compound leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbrella-like clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. This species is adapted to humid, well-drained soils and plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
